name: Automate Daily GLPI Pending Ticket Notifications to Microsoft Teams

user.name: Luis Hernandez
user.bio: I like solving problems and have a true passion for no-code automation. I'm thoughtful by nature and enjoy finding ways to optimize processes, always guided by my principles and values.

description:
GLPI Pending Tickets Notification to Microsoft Teams

üìã Overview
Automate daily notifications for pending GLPI tickets directly to Microsoft Teams. Never miss critical support cases with this workflow that monitors assigned tickets and sends personal alerts.

üîß How It Works

Connect to GLPI - Authenticates and searches for your assigned tickets
Filter Results - Finds tickets in "In Progress" status within your entity
Send Notifications - Delivers formatted alerts to your Teams chat
Clean Up - Properly closes GLPI session for security

üìä What Gets Monitored

Tickets assigned to specific technician (configurable)
Status: "In Progress/Assigned"
Entity: Your organization (customizable)
Date range: Tickets after specified date

‚ö° Key Benefits

Never Miss Deadlines - Daily automated reminders
Personal Focus - Only your assigned tickets
Time Savings - Eliminates manual checking (15-30 min daily)
Rich Details - Shows ticket title, ID, and due date

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Steps
Time Required: ~30 minutes

Import Template - Add workflow to your n8n instance
Configure GLPI - Set server URL, credentials, and app token
Set Technician ID - Update to your GLPI user ID
Connect Teams - Link your Microsoft Teams account
Customize Filters - Adjust entity name and date range
Test & Schedule - Verify notifications and set daily trigger

üé® Easy Customization

Change technician ID for different users
Adjust notification schedule (default: 8 AM daily)
Modify entity filters for your organization
Add multiple technicians by duplicating workflow

üìã Prerequisites

GLPI instance with API enabled
GLPI user account with ticket read permissions
Microsoft Teams account (basic license)
n8n with Microsoft Teams integration

Perfect for support technicians who want automated reminders about their pending GLPI tickets without manual daily checks.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.content:
## Schedule Trigger
Define the workflow execution schedule that best suits you.

## Node http request
Get session token

Method: Get

URL:https://"your_glpi_server"/apirest.php/initSession/

Authentication: Generic Credential Type
Generic Auth Type: Basic Auth
Basic Auth: User/Password | Credential glpi application manager



Send Headers

Content-Type: application/json
App-Token: "Your App Token is here"

## Node http request
Get pending cases 

Method: GET

URL: https://"your_glpi_server"/apirest.php/search/Ticket/


Send Query Parameters

criteria[0][field]: 5
criteria[0][searchtype]: equals
criteria[0][value]: "Change to id_technnician ej: 8"
criteria[1][link]: AND
criteria[1][field]: 12
criteria[1][searchtype]: equals
criteria[1][value]: 2
criteria[2][link]: AND
criteria[2][field]: 15
criteria[2][searchtype]: morethan
criteria[2][value]: 2024-08-01
criteria[3][link]: AND
criteria[3][field]: 80
criteria[3][searchtype]: contains
criteria[3][value]: "Change to entity_name"
order: DESC

Send Headers

Content-Type: application/json
Session-Token: {{ $json.session_token }}
App-Token:  "Your App Token is here"

## Node IF
Are there any ongoing cases?

Conditions

{{ $json.totalcount }} # is greater than 0

If they exist = true
If they do not exist = false

## Node Split Out
If there is more than one case, I separate them so I can iterate them correctly.

## Node Aggregate
I regroup all the elements after they've been iterated.

## Node End session
Method: GET

URL: https://"your_glpi_server"/apirest.php/killSession/

Send Headers

Session-Token : {{ $('Get session token').item.json.session_token }}
App-Token: "Your App Token is here"

## Create chat message

Credential to connect whith "We must create the connection with the Microsoft Teams account that has a basic or standard license."

Resource: Chat Message
Operation: Create
Chat: from list "Start a chat with the technician of this flow so that it appears on the list."

In the Microsoft admin center, go to "Enterprise apps > n8n app - User and groups > add user and group." Add the Teams account that will be used to send notifications.
